prompts.prompt: I just wrote a new JavaScript concept page about closures with several code examples. Can you create Vitest tests to make sure all the examples actually work correctly?

My documentation page has some DOM manipulation examples that use document.createElement and event listeners. I need tests for these but I'm not sure how to set up the DOM testing environment properly.
I have a concept page about async/await with Promise examples, some that resolve and some that reject. Help me write comprehensive tests that cover all the async patterns shown in the documentation.
Can you look at this concept page about primitive types and write tests for the typeof examples? There are console.log statements with expected outputs that need to be verified.

I need tests for a concept page that has intentional error examples - things like accessing properties on null and division by zero errors. How do I properly test that these throw the right exceptions?

My JavaScript fundamentals page has floating point arithmetic examples showing precision issues like 0.1 + 0.2. I need tests that properly handle these floating point comparisons without false failures.

I wrote a comprehensive concept page about JavaScript functions with examples covering closures, higher-order functions, arrow functions, and some DOM event handlers. I need a complete test suite that organizes tests by documentation sections and handles both regular and DOM examples properly.
There's a concept page with setTimeout and Promise examples that demonstrate the event loop. Some examples are timing-dependent. How do I write reliable tests for these without making them flaky?

I have a concept page about object-oriented programming with class examples, inheritance, and method calls. The examples show console.log outputs and return values. Generate the test file following the project's naming conventions.

My concept page covers advanced topics like strict mode behavior, closure state management, and array method chaining. There are also some browser-only API examples that can't run in Node. I need a complete test strategy that handles all these cases appropriately, including what to skip and why.
